alert.note: Alert for Box Elder; Cache; Davis; Morgan; Tooele; Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 09 at 5:16PM MST until January 09 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Weber County in northern Utah... Southwestern Cache County in northern Utah... Southeastern Box Elder County in northern Utah... Davis County in northern Utah... West central Morgan County in northern Utah... Northeastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 515 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Utah State University to 16 miles south of Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway, moving east southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Utah Department of Transportation officials, webcams, radar and observations. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 327 and 376. Interstate 84 between mile markers 82 and 99. US Route 89 between mile markers 459 and 461. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Layton, Logan, Brigham City, Hill Air Force Base, Roy, Clearfield, Kaysville, Syracuse, Clinton, North Ogden, South Ogden, Washington Terrace, Riverdale, Hyrum, Hooper, South Weber, Perry, Wellsville, and Willard. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED

area.areaDesc: Box Elder; Cache; Davis; Morgan; Tooele; Weber
